verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210>. O sing<WH7891> unto the LORD<WH3068> a new<WH2319> song<WH7892>; for he hath done<WH6213> marvellous things<WH6381>: his right hand<WH3225>, and his holy<WH6944> arm<WH2220>, hath gotten him the victory<WH3467>.
The LORD<WH3068> hath made known<WH3045> his salvation<WH3444>: his righteousness<WH6666> hath he openly shewed<WH1540> in the sight<WH5869> of the heathen<WH1471>.

He hath remembered<WH2142> his mercy<WH2617> and his truth<WH530> toward the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>: all the ends<WH657> of the earth<WH776> have seen<WH7200> the salvation<WH3444> of our God<WH430>.
Make a joyful noise<WH7321> unto the LORD<WH3068>, all the earth<WH776>: make a loud noise<WH6476>, and rejoice<WH7442>, and sing<WH2167> praise.
Sing<WH2167> unto the LORD<WH3068> with the harp<WH3658>; with the harp<WH3658>, and the voice<WH6963> of a psalm<WH2172>.
With trumpets<WH2689> and sound<WH6963> of cornet<WH7782> make a joyful noise<WH7321> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>, the King<WH4428>.
Let the sea<WH3220> roar<WH7481>, and the fulness<WH4393> thereof; the world<WH8398>, and they that dwell<WH3427> therein.
Let the floods<WH5104> clap<WH4222> their hands<WH3709>: let the hills<WH2022> be joyful<WH7442> together<WH3162>

Before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>; for he cometh<WH935> to judge<WH8199> the earth<WH776>: with righteousness<WH6664> shall he judge<WH8199> the world<WH8398>, and the people<WH5971> with equity<WH4339>.
